results.title: Statins demonstrate a broad anti-cytomegalovirus activity in vitro in ganciclovir-susceptible and resistant strains.
results.text_hl: In this study, the in vitro anti-@<m>DISEASE_Cytomegalovirus_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003586 @@@CMV@@@ activity of four statins (atorva-, @CHEMICAL_Fluvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077340 @@@fluva@@@-, @CHEMICAL_Lomustine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008130 @@@prava@@@-, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@) was explored in @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ aortic endothelial cells (HAEC) and fibroblasts.

citations.NLM: Ponroy N, Taveira A, Mueller NJ, Millard AL. Statins demonstrate a broad anti-cytomegalovirus activity in vitro in ganciclovir-susceptible and resistant strains. J Med Virol. 2015 Jan;87(1):141-53. PMID: 24976258
